Description.val: The Multifunctional Information Distribution System Low Volume Terminal (MIDS LVT) is a communications device that provides situational awareness information exchange between aircraft, airborne command and control, Ground Air Defense and shipboard platforms in the Tactical Data Link-16 Network. The Army variant consists of three Line Replaceable Units (Main Terminal, Power Supply Assembly and Cooling Unit) installed on a mounting base, which physically and functionally replaces the JTIDS Class 2M terminal. The Army Acquisition Objective (AAO) for MIDS is 812.

Justification.val:
FY2013 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $7.798 million support procurement of 23 MIDS-LVT(2/11) terminals for the Air Defense Airspace Management (ADAM) Cells, Terminal High Altitude Air Defense (THAAD), Integrated Battle Command System (IBCS), and Medium Extended Air Defense System (MEADS) in support of the Army Transformation Plan. FY2013 Base dollars also procure system project management and software support for previously procured MIDS-LVT(2/11) terminals deployed to air defense platforms including Patriot, Forward Area Air Defense Command and Control (FAADC2), Joint Land Attack Cruise Missile Defense Elevated Netted Sensor (JLENS), Joint Tactical Ground Station (JTAGS), and Unmanned Aerial System (UAS).

All funds support Active Component.
